subject: Ethics
title: Surrogacy Ethics Worldwide
description: A fast breakdown of Surrogacy Ethics Worldwide for builders.

hook.text: A woman in India carries a baby for a couple in New York. She's paid $5,000. They pay the clinic $30,000.

buildup.text: Commercial surrogacy lets people who can't carry a pregnancy hire someone who can.

discovery.text: Supporters call it reproductive freedom. Critics call it renting a woman's body.

twist.text: In poor countries, surrogates often have few alternatives. Is it free choice or economic coercion?

climax.text: India banned commercial surrogacy in 2021. Other countries embrace it. The ethics remain unresolved.

punchline.text: Consent without equal power isn't quite consent.

quiz.question: What is the central ethical concern with commercial surrogacy in developing countries?
options: Economic inequality may compromise truly free consent
